intro: Alluaudia ascendens, commonly known as the climbing alluaudia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
